reviews.review: I think this movie is cute and fun with funny moments. I would recommend this movie to anybody who has seen the first three.
The canadian motorcycle guy didnt say oi.

Kind of boring and frustrating. The film did not have a sense of adventure or fun. The sub text of the film was stressful and a source frustration. No laughs, no fun moments. The subject matter was heavy...it's a kids film for crying out loud. The story did not need to be told. It seemed more aimed at adults than kids. Most of the film is played out in the antique store. The antique store is gloomy and depressing. The film had no ingenuity or levity. Very meh.

People didn't want a toy story 4 as it would ruined the way that toy story 3 ended, but it didn't at all. This isn't a "Andy" film, this one is focusing on Bonnie growing up with the toys and also showing us that Woody needs to move on from being Andy's favourite toy. Yes this film moves away from focusing on the main set of toys to focus on the brand new set of characters, but that's where the humour comes from and this is definitely the funniest toy story movie and its down to the new characters, the main stand out is Forky, the chemistry with him and Woody is 2 stand out performances inside this film. The main villain, Gabby Gabby is probably the most complex villain in the franchise, but I don't think she is the greatest villain, but still great to watch. Bringing back Bo Peep into the fold really helps to bring Woody's arc to a wonderful and emotional ending. However I do not think this is the most emotional toy story film as that belongs to toy story 3, but it's still emotional to see what happens at the end of the film, especially the final words that Woody and Buzz share together. That door has closed, or has it?????  
What a way to end the most perfect animated franchise, and one of the most perfect (if not the perfect) film franchise ever made.....

Toy Story 3 wrapped up on a seemingly conclusive note. That all changed when Toy Story 4 was announced. Upon learning of a fourth sequel, I was unsurprised and disappointed at Disney's seemingly endless level of corporate greed.

Cynicism aside, I was pleasantly surprised (to an extent). Toy Story 4 manages to retain the charm and whimsy of the earlier films and isn't a total soulless cash-grab. I actually liked the themes it explored as well as the new characters - Forky's existential crises and Key/Peele's arguing were both quite enjoyable. This was a good, not amazing, Toy Story film that is likely to leave fans of the franchise or just fans of Pixar in general pleased.
Pixar allways do great or better. It is not the best toy story but it is almost.
A Disney fallowing you heart story, Toy Story edition. I how the we fallows greatness, glory, eternity and no to be conform to this world. It we be better and the best is yet to come.

This may be the worst in the franchise, but considering the other three were practically masterpieces of animation, that's not to say this is bad at all. Toy Story 4 is a surprising addition to the franchise that I didn't know we needed that has the characters we know and love and still love, new characters that are funny and not annoying, an entertaining adventure, a compelling villain, incredible animation that almost looks photo realistic, and a fulfilling, emotional, and bittersweet ending. One of the best of 2019 so far.

This was probably my least favorite of all four movies. I wasn’t a fan of the super creepy and much darker story line, which included ventriloquist dummies, kidnapping, and characters with psychopathic, manipulative abilities. It also just didn’t feel as funny as the other movies, and I prefer the lighthearted feel of the first three films.

We've loved each Toy Story up until now, but unfortunately #4 doesn't live up to the high standards. This one isn't as funny, the characters aren't as interesting, the stakes are lower, and it lacks the emotional resonance of the others. TS4 was a disappointment which added nothing to the series.
